keyword: how many calories in chicken thighs boneless skinless
title: How Many Calories in Boneless Skinless Chicken Thighs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chicken thighs boneless skinless per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition tweaks for your meals.
h1: How Many Calories in Boneless Skinless Chicken Thighs?
assumptions: Cooked (roasted or grilled) boneless, skinless chicken thighs; no added oil, seasonings, or sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cooking method, portion size, brand, and preparation; values are approximate. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked boneless skinless chicken thigh provides ~177 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g during cooking
Baked with skin (vs. skinless) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g boneless skinless chicken thighs?
What's the protein in boneless skinless chicken thighs?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein per 100 g cooked.

faqs.q: Do boneless skinless chicken thighs have carbs?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”pure protein and fat source.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in chicken thighs?
faqs.a: Grilling or roasting keeps calories lower; frying or adding oil increases them significantly.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked chicken thighs?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw is lower in calories per gram due to water loss during cooking.
